description: Round 8 TB Grant: Towards universal access: Improving accessibility to high quality DOTs in Zimbabwe

subproject.description:
The overall goal of the proposal is to further strengthen and expand the activities of the National Tuberculosis Program, by building on activities funded under the R5 grant to Zimbabwe and addressing some of the remaining identified gaps and weaknesses.
Target Group/Beneficiaries:
TB patients, people living with HIV/AIDS, population at risk.
Strategies:
Advocacy, community and social mobilization, improve timely diagnosis and quality treatment of TB cases, community TB care, health system strengthening, directly observed treatment short course (DOTS)
Planned activities:
Include, retention of critical staff, establish two peripheral microscopy centres per district to make diagnostic services  more accessible to the rural population, develop TB laboratory quality assurance systems and ensure consistently high standards of TB related activities,provide X-ray machines to each province, central hospitals and to infectious disease/TB hospitals.
subproject.title: Improving accessibility to hig

subproject.corporate outcome: Strengthened capacities to mainstream action into national policies, plans and strategies on the socio-economic causes and consequences of HIV and the linkage to the health MDG

title: Improving accessibility to high quality DOTs in Zimbabwe
